workflow.name: Track Amazon product prices with ScrapeOps API & Google Sheets alerts
workflow.description:
# Amazon Product Price Tracker

This workflow automatically monitors Amazon product prices, tracks price changes, and sends alerts when significant price fluctuations occur. Built with ScrapeOps' structured data API, it provides a reliable, maintenance-free solution for price tracking without worrying about anti-bot measures or complex selectors.

## What This Workflow Does

- Monitors multiple Amazon products simultaneously using their ASINs
- Calculates both absolute and percentage price changes
- Sends customizable email alerts when prices cross defined thresholds
- Maintains a historical record of all price data for trend analysis
- Updates a Google Sheets with the latest price information

## Prerequisites

- A ScrapeOps API key (register at https://scrapeops.io)
- Google account for Google Sheets integration
- SMTP email configuration for alerts

## Setup Instructions

1. **Spreadsheet Setup**
   - Make a copy of the template spreadsheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1hRv-TBXrpN6rkIU65WorttNHt-IPWas_An0sF4Of39U
   - Add your Amazon product ASINs in the "Products to Monitor" sheet
   - Set your desired alert thresholds for price increases/decreases

2. **Workflow Configuration**
   - Add your ScrapeOps API key to the "Setup" node
   - Update the spreadsheet URL in the "Setup" node with YOUR copy
   - Configure your email settings for notifications
   - Adjust the schedule frequency as needed (default: hourly)

## How It Works

The workflow reads product ASINs from your Google Sheet, fetches current pricing data via ScrapeOps' Amazon Product API, calculates price changes, updates your spreadsheet, and sends alerts when price movements exceed your defined thresholds.

Unlike traditional web scrapers that break when websites change, this solution uses ScrapeOps' reliable API that handles all the complexity of Amazon data extraction, ensuring consistent results without maintenance.

## Additional Notes

- This workflow is ideal for deal hunters, price comparison services, and e-commerce analytics
- The alerting system can be extended to additional channels like Slack or Telegram
- ScrapeOps handles all anti-bot measures, proxy management, and parsing complexities

assignments.name: percent_change

parameters.subject: =Amazon Price Tracker Alert: {{ $('Update - Products to Monitor').item.json.name }} Price Change Detected

parameters.content:
# Amazon Product Price Tracker

This workflow automates price monitoring for Amazon products using the ScrapeOps API. It tracks price changes over time, alerts you when prices cross your defined thresholds, and maintains a historical record of all price movements.

## Features
- Scheduled price checks for multiple Amazon products
- Price change calculations (absolute and percentage)
- Smart alerting based on customizable thresholds
- Automated email notifications with detailed price information
- Historical price tracking for trend analysis

## API Configuration
This workflow requires a ScrapeOps API key to fetch Amazon product data.
To obtain your API key, register at https://scrapeops.io/app/register/main

## API Documentation
For detailed information about the Amazon Product API endpoint used in this workflow,
refer to the official documentation at:
https://scrapeops.io/docs/data-api/amazon-product-api/
The documentation provides details on all available parameters, response formats,
and best practices for optimizing your API usage.

## Integration Setup
Once registered, insert your API key in the "Scrapeops - Amazon Product" node parameters.
This workflow uses the structured data endpoint which returns clean, parsed product data
in a consistent JSON format.

## Google Sheets Configuration
A Google Sheets spreadsheet is used to store the product data collected through this workflow.
The original template spreadsheet is shared in read-only mode through this link:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1hRv-TBXrpN6rkIU65WorttNHt-IPWas_An0sF4Of39U

To use this workflow:
1. Access the shared spreadsheet using the link above
2. Make your own copy by going to File > Make a copy
3. Share your copy with appropriate permissions
4. In the n8n workflow, locate the "Setup" node
5. Update the "spreadsheet_url" variable with the link to YOUR copy of the spreadsheet

This ensures each user works with their own separate spreadsheet, avoiding data overlap 
between different users while maintaining the original structure needed by the workflow.

user.name: ScrapeOps
user.bio: ScrapeOps provides enterprise-grade web scraping infrastructure. Our tools eliminate common challenges like proxy management, anti-bot protection, and maintenance headaches. We power data-driven applications through reliable APIs and monitoring solutions. Explore our n8n workflows for seamless data extraction.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
